column4: I'd like to export my home across campus. I'll mainly be using macs, but will want to access it from a PC on occasion. How can I decide between netatalk/samba, nfs/samba, or just samba? I've only briefly worked with nfs, and such sharing still seems to be a bit of black magic to me.
try not using netatalk and samba.  try ssh, scp...you connect and get the files and you are in and out.
That's what I've been doing, however, I'd like to be able to let Vim and other local tools run amok in my remote home.
That's something I hadn't thought about. I'll look into it! Thanks!
